message.entry: OBJ must be open before writing video. Call open(obj) before calling writeVideo.
Frame must be {0,number,integer} by {1,number,integer}
IMG must be of one of the following classes: {0}
Frames of type {0} must be in the range 0 to 1.
IMG must be an array of either grayscale or RGB images.
FRAME must have the fields ''cdata'' and ''colormap''.
The ''cdata'' field of FRAME must not be empty
All ''cdata'' fields in FRAMES must be the same size.
The frames provided to a single call of writeVideo must either all have a colormap or all lack a colormap.
All ''cdata'' fields with a specified ''colormap'' must be two dimensional.
Unable to convert a frame into an RGB image.
All cdata fields of MOV must have the same data type if cdata contains a truecolor image.
If the colormap field is empty in a frame, cdata must contain an RGB image.
The current profile does not support writing frames.
Creating empty profiles is not allowed.
Setting the CompressionRatio when LosslessCompression is enabled is not allowed.
The CompressionRatio property has previously been modified. CompressionRatio is ignored when LosslessCompression is enabled.
A file name must be specified.
The profile must be specified as a character vector or a string scalar.
The specified folder, {0}, does not exist
Cannot create file {0}. Permission Denied.
Creating video file in remote location is not supported.
OBJ must be a 1x1 VideoWriter object.
No video frames were written to this file. The file may be invalid.
The value of the Duration property is read-only
The value of the FileFormat property is read-only
VideoWriter objects cannot be concatenated.
Unsupported data type {0} for the chosen file type.
The requested conversion of {0} to {1} is not supported by writeVideo.
Modifying the {0} property of a {1} object is not allowed after OPEN has been called.
File name must be a non-empty character vector or string scalar.
FrameRate must be a positive scalar.
One or more properties of the video is invalid. Ensure 'Quality' and 'FrameRate' properties of the object and the frame dimensions are within allowed range.
Unable to initialize the JPEG compression library.
Could not open the video file for writing.
Could not initialize the video file for writing.
Could not write a video frame.
Unable to compress a frame using the JPEG library.
Unexpected error from Kakadu library: {0}
Unexpected error.
Unexpected Error writing file: {0}
The specified profile is not valid.
Setting the BufferSize property is not allowed while the object is open.
The video's width and height has been padded to be a multiple of two as required by the H.264 codec.
General Properties:
Video Properties:
The specified profile is not valid.

Video file compression with JPEG 2000 codec with lossless mode enabled.
Video file compression with JPEG 2000 codec.
An AVI file with Motion JPEG compression
An AVI file with uncompressed RGB24 video data
A MPEG-4 file with H.264 Compression
An AVI file with Indexed Video Data
An AVI file with Grayscale Video Data

Summary of installed VideoWriter profiles:\n\n
Properties:
Failed to initialize MediaFoundation
Could not close the video file after writing.
Could not set the Colormap. Reason: {0}
Colormap required when writing an Indexed AVI file.
Colormap provided is invalid. Colormap should be a Px3 matrix with a maximum of 256 entries.
Colormap specified for the first frame does not match existing value.
Colormap must be the same for all frames being written. Palette changes are not supported by VideoWriter.
The ''colormap'' field in FRAMES must be empty when writing Grayscale AVI.

IMG cannot contain three color bands when writing Grayscale or Indexed AVI. If IMG is truecolor convert it to grayscale or indexed. If IMG is already grayscale or indexed, reshape the data to be HxWx1xF.
For Indexed AVI files, the pixel values in the data being written must be less than size ({0}) of the Colormap.
File name contains invalid characters.
